text:
I have a problem decrypting confidential transactions:
Getting unexpected results from confidential chaincode: The Node SDK seems to do the decryption of the payload, but the result isn’t as expected (example setting a value of 2000, would be retrieved  as 32303030 and a value of 1234 would be retrieved as (31323334)…so 3 interlaced in these integer examples, but completely different for other non-integer values). Is there a need for some format conversion or am I missing a step somewhere?

The chaincode behaviour is as expected when confidential flag is set to false.

Setup: Using hfc 0.6.2, go chaincode, docker on Mac (1 MS and 1 VP), chaincode in DEV mode, Privacy and Security enabled.
who should I add for review for fabric/sdk/node part of code? <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/1823/>.  very simple fix for invalid log messages. Thank you.
<@U0NLP5909> I just added some relevant people.
Looks good, thanks for noticing and fixing! Adding my +1.
